Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery phallus cup; white slip; interior: glazed very streaky black save for lower shaft; exterior: central shaft, decorated with black and reserved bands, below broken off area, presemably a vulva; to one side part of an elongated tongue.
Curator's comments: For discussion of the shape, see Williams 2006a, o. 127-8. Lemos has the wrong registration number (1888.6-1.496bis) and wrongly says the piece is no longer in the BM collection (1991, 24, note 27). For parallels regarding the shape, see British Museum 1888,0601.496.a-c.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 24 note 27, p. 250, no. 366) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.496bis.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1930) (phase 2)
